intro: Bupleurum wolffianum, commonly known as Wolff's bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in late spring, forming dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Bupleurum wolffianum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
